words.definition: A coward is a person who lacks courage to do risky or dangerous things.
words.example: A firefighter cannot be a coward. They have to be able to act quickly.

words.definition: To delete something means to remove or erase written material.
words.example: Several lines had been deleted from her speech.

words.definition: If something is firsthand, then it is from an original source.
words.example: If you want firsthand knowledge, ask someone who saw it.

words.definition: If someone is earnest, then they are honest and serious.
words.example: The child was very earnest when she told her mother how she broke the dish.

words.definition: If something is ethnic, then it is related to a group with a similar culture.
words.example: Many sections of the city are home to different ethnic communities.

words.definition: To exclude someone means to not accept them into a group.
words.example: Carol was excluded from the contest because her friend was a judge.

words.definition: If someone is fluent in a language, then they are able to speak it very well.
words.example: She was so fluent in German that you’d have thought she was from Germany.

words.definition: If something is imperial, then it is of, or related to an empire.
words.example: These old imperial coins were once used in the Roman Empire.

words.definition: If something is inclusive, then it is open to all groups and people in society.
words.example: A more inclusive event would have allowed children to attend.

words.definition: A legislature is the section of a government that makes laws.
words.example: The senator had served ten years in the national legislature.

words.definition: If something is linguistic, then it is concerned with language.
words.example: A linguistic way of studying culture focuses on words within that culture.

words.definition: If someone is monolingual, then they speak only one language.
words.example: In today’s global economy, being monolingual limits your opportunities.

words.definition: Nationality is the state of belonging to a particular country.
words.example: She has American nationality but was born in Japan.

words.definition: A patriot is a person who loves and supports their country.
words.example: The monument was built to honor the patriots who died in the war.

words.definition: To prosecute someone means to take legal action against them in court.
words.example: The company decided to prosecute the person who stole its secrets.

words.definition: If something is racial, it relates to a person's race.
words.example: The government is working to end racial discrimination.

words.definition: If something is solemn, it is very serious and formal.
words.example: The judge spoke in a solemn voice when he gave the verdict.

words.definition: Solidarity is support by one person or group for another because they share feelings or aims.
words.example: The workers showed solidarity by going on strike together.

words.definition: Tact is the ability to do or say things without offending people.
words.example: She used a lot of tact when she told him that he didn't get the job.

words.definition: To undermine something means to make it weaker or less effective.
words.example: His constant criticism undermined her confidence.
